# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python
# For example, here's several helpful packages to load

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import gpxpy, folium, branca #to print coordinates on maps

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.7f888a82:
gpx_file1 = open('/kaggle/input/criminal-location-tracking/GPS_Data/GPS 1.gpx', 'r')
gpx_file2 = open('/kaggle/input/criminal-location-tracking/GPS_Data/GPS 2.gpx', 'r')

#Parse the xml gpx
gpx1 = gpxpy.parse(gpx_file1)
gpx2 = gpxpy.parse(gpx_file2)
source.11dc691b:
#Generate the map
map1 = folium.Map(location=(52.379, 4.900), zoom_start=11.5)


    
for waypoint1 in gpx1.waypoints:
    person1 = waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude
    
    #Add point person1
    folium.Marker(location=(waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude), popup="GPS_1 latitude:"+str(waypoint1.latitude)+" longitute:"+str(waypoint1.longitude), 
                  icon=folium.Icon(color="blue", icon="info-sign")).add_to(map1)
            
for waypoint2 in gpx2.waypoints:
    
    person2 = waypoint2.latitude, waypoint2.longitude
    
    #Add point person2
    folium.Marker(location=(waypoint2.latitude, waypoint2.longitude),popup="GPS_2 latitude:"+str(waypoint2.latitude)+" longitute:"+str(waypoint2.longitude),
                  icon=folium.Icon(color="green", icon="info-sign")).add_to(map1)
    
    for waypoint1 in gpx1.waypoints:
            
        #Find meeting point
        if person1 == person2:
            print('Waypoint meet -> ({0},{1},{2})'.format(waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude, waypoint1.time))
            
            folium.Marker(location=(waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude), popup="MEET latitude:"+str(waypoint1.latitude)+" longitute:"+str(waypoint1.longitude),
                          icon=folium.Icon(color="red", icon="info-sign")).add_to(map1)
        else:
            pass
          
display(map1)
source.35726a34:
map2 = folium.Map(location=(52.379, 4.900), zoom_start=17)

for waypoint2 in gpx2.waypoints:
    
    person2 = waypoint2.latitude, waypoint2.longitude
       
    for waypoint1 in gpx1.waypoints:
        
        person1 = waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude
        #Find meeting point
        if person1 == person2:
            print('Waypoint meet PERSON1 -> ({0},{1},{2})'.format(waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude, waypoint1.time))
            print('Waypoint meet PERSON2 -> ({0},{1},{2})'.format(waypoint1.latitude, waypoint2.longitude, waypoint2.time))
            
            folium.Marker(location=(waypoint1.latitude, waypoint1.longitude), popup="MEET latitude:"+str(waypoint1.latitude)+" longitute:"+str(waypoint1.longitude),
                          icon=folium.Icon(color="red", icon="info-sign")).add_to(map2)
        else:
            pass
          
display(map2)
source.a5749e29:
# Conclusions

Both people were at the same point at different times and shared the same route

We must bear in mind that if the two people are criminals and have been in the same place at different times, it is possible that they have shared a written message or drugs, weapons, etc.

Waypoint meet PERSON1 -> (52.379129359927155,4.900267124176025,2019-11-05 11:47:16+00:00)
Waypoint meet PERSON2 -> (52.379129359927155,4.900267124176025,2019-11-05 14:16:49+00:00)
